author: katernoir
content: Hey, I'm not sure if this is the right channel to ask this, but I'm trying to understand validator deposits after the merge / after shanghai. As far I understand, the deposit contract will still exist after the merge and validators will have the same flow there as right now. Is that correct? Looking at EIP-4895 (I know this is not finalized), withdrawals will later then be pushed to the withdrawal address as a balance change. Accounting for the ETH in the deposit contract, does that mean that by staking and unstaking I basically make 64 ETH out of 32 (32 new ETH on the withdrawal address and 32 inacessible in the deposit contract)?

author: sky.cactus
content: Nothing changes with regards to deposits or withdraws with The Merge.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is active research/development on withdraws, but that won't land on mainnet until sometime after The Merge (no timeline yet).

author: sky.cactus
content: For questions about EIP-4895, the best place to ask would be in the discussions-to thread (link at the top of the EIP).  I believe there is discussion around whether we should care about the "total supply" of ETH becoming more complex to calculate or not.

content: Thanks! I totally missed the discussion link at the top of the page! Will read through the track and ask any remaining questions there ✌️
